entry.title: Why wouldn't a minority indicator populate for every line on a PO?
entry.content:
Hi everyone, 

I have a question surrounding minority indicators. Why wouldn't a minority indicator populate for every line on a PO? At the vendor master level, the minority indicator is populated for a supplier but when a purchase order is released, not every line populates the minority indicator. 

Any insight into this? Appreciate any guidance.

entry.title: Re: splitting 100000 records to two internal tables and post in al11
entry.content:
I don't know if your question is about splitting or uploading.

Let's assume it's about splitting. It's very simple ABAP code:

DATA(itab_1) = VALUE tt_itab( ( LINES OF itab FROM 1 TO 50000 ) ).
DATA(itab_2) = VALUE tt_itab( ( LINES OF itab FROM 50001 TO 100000 ) ).

entry.title: Pharma Distribution Inquiry
entry.content:
Hello, I'm Kiely,  a 4th year undergraduate student studying business at the University of Michigan. I am currently working on a project analyzing different ERP systems for a hypothetical company. As we navigate this project we are learning about the different capabilities this tool would need to achieve in order to implement the most appropriate system for our company. I was hoping someone could offer guidance by sharing what options and prices would best suit this "company." 

Here is the prompt we were given to help you better understand the context.: 

Background 

Company is a $4B wholesale distributor that has been in the business of reselling branded and generic pharmaceuticals for nearly 60 years. The company warehouses FDA regulated products and sells them to hospitals and pharmacies throughout the United States. Wholesale Distribution (WSD) is a difficult business model as a result of suppliers and customers applying pressure at both ends of the buying cycle. Like other WSD companies in the industry, Company has delayed deploying a true ERP solution and has historically minimized its digital investments. Company‚Äôs primary legacy business system is going off maintenance in two year and needs to formulate an ERP Strategy. The Consultant is being engaged to develop the strategy as well as provide a shortlist of possible solutions that support the Consultant‚Äôs findings. The COO is serving as the project sponsor and will sign off on all final deliverables. 

 

Scope 

The scope of this SOW is to complete an ERP Strategy and provide a shortlist of ERP systems that are best suited for the Company. Key considerations include best of breed vs. single integrated platform, cloud vs. on-premise, and tier 1 vs. tier 2 software. The Consultant will examine the market to determine what specialized industry solutions exist to satisfy the unique needs in WSD. The Consultant will present insights and propose recommendations that the executive management team can use for commencing a Request-for-Proposal (RFP) selection process.

 

It would be really helpful to our team to hear from experts/users of these programs so that we can fully understand the processes as if this were a real world scenario. Thank you!

Kiely üôÇ

SAP Advanced Track and Trace for Pharmaceuticals 

SAP enhancement package for SAP ERP, version for SAP HANA

entry.title: Using SAC, create a hierarchical structure that has the same GLAccount number
entry.content:
Using SAC, create a hierarchical structure that has the same GLAccount number for the GLAccountHierarchy and ParentNode columns.

When trying to load data into the Modeler Model using SAC, the hierarchical structure defined is GLAccountHierarchy --> ParentNode --> GLAccount.

The data listed in GLAccountHiearchywithParentandAccount.txt should be used. The data load is not functioning properly because multiple GLAccounts have the same GLAccountHierarchy and ParentNode column values. 

How can I resolve this issue? What is the process for creating a GL Account Hierarchy structure with this data?

Thanks again.

entry.title: Re: How to customize push notification payload to send additional data from s/4 to SSAM
entry.content: There is no BAdI option for this. You can subclass /MFND/CL_CORE_OTRIG_CPMS_PUSH and reimplement BUILD_JSON_DATA to format the payload how you want. I tested this in our system & the push processing is executed after the notification is saved. I think you should be able to read the data from the table. Have you tried this?

entry.title: Re: 10-digit Unique transaction Identification number in...
entry.content:
Dear @Riya20,

In Public Cloud there is no extra standard 10-digit transaction ID in Manage Automatic Payments app besides the payment document number and payment reference. The EndToEndId in the DME is, by SAP standard, supposed to be derived from the payment document number

SAP Note below:

https://me.sap.com/notes/0003287758

If you really need a different 10-digit unique ID per transaction for the <EndToEndId> tag, you have to go via extensibility

SAP Note for Public Cloud say:

  • <EndToEndId> are expected to be based on the payment document number (optionally with company code prefix/suffix)
  • The mapping is controlled in CBC Map Format Data for Payments (100558)

So if you change EndToEndId to some completely custom number, be aware:

  • Monitor Payments / pain.002 matching may no longer work out-of-the-box, because SAP assumes EndToEndId encodes the payment document number

SAP Note below:

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2763473

  • If you‚Äôre using Bank Communication Management your bank feedback might not auto-reconcile anymore.

More details below:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/b8e68a90bfff4ff0906d5db5342bdece/4e5f1eec26a84221b83e9f5f8cc65112.html

If you‚Äôre fine with that, you can still implement a extensibility.

Easiest config-only option (if you can still base it on doc no.)

  1. Go to CBC, Map Format Data for Payments (100558)
  2. Open your outgoing format mapping
  3. Search for the node EndToEndId.

 

  1. In the mapping you can:
    • Concatenate constants (like company code or year) with the document number, or
    • Use formatting functions (substring, padding) if available in your format mapping.

Example:

EndToEndId = BUKRS (2) + last 8 digits of Payment Document No.

Result: DE0123456789

 

 

Technically it‚Äôs still derived from the payment document, but it looks like a different ID and is still unique and 10-digit.

Best Regards,

Dawid

entry.title: SAP Developer News 20th November 2025
entry.content:
ITEMS

Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Singapore  

  • SAP Teched home https://www.sap.com/events/teched.html  

CAP ‚Äì Advanced Event Mesh plugin 

  • @cap-js/advanced-event-mesh plugin https://github.com/cap-js/advanced-event-mesh 
  • CAP Plugin for SAP Integration Suite, Advanced Event Mesh https://help.sap.com/docs/sap-integration-suite/advanced-event-mesh/cap-plugin-for-sap-integration-suite-advanced-event-mesh 

UKISUG Connect 2025 

  • Event website https://www.ukisugconnect.co.uk/ 
  • Agenda https://virtual.oxfordabstracts.com/event/75555/program  

SAP BTP ABAP Environment - Release 2511 

  • Blog post https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-btp-abap-environment-release-2511/ba-p/14257787 

Devtoberfest 2024 winner interviews at SAP TechEd 2025 ‚Äì Michael Teti 

  • Devtoberfest details https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/devtoberfest-2025-welcome/ba-p/14182817  

CHAPTER TITLES

0:00 Intro 
0:07 Field report from SAP TechEd on Tour in Singapore 
0:50 CAP ‚Äì Advanced Event Mesh plugin 
1:21 UKISUG Connect 2025 
2:45 SAP BTP ABAP Environment ‚Äì Release 2511 
4:00 Devtoberfest 2024 winner interviews at SAP TechEd 2025 ‚Äì Michael Teti 

TRANSCRIPT

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for November 20th, 2025.

[Tom] Hey, everybody. Welcome from the TechEd on Tour. We're here in Singapore today for a CodeJam, our second to last stop on the TechEd on Tour. Next week, we'll be in Bangalore for the big TechEd event there. Everybody looking forward to that? Yeah. Yeah. Yeah, right now we're here in the SAP offices of Singapore. And if you see behind us, there is Ella, the robotic barista, making Rich a hot chocolate right now. So we're enjoying the comforts of the SAP office and looking forward to seeing everybody in Bangalore next week. So until then, we'll see you there. See you there. Bye. Bye.

[Antonio] Hola, SAP developers. In case you missed it, there is a new CAP plugin in town. the Advanced Event Mesh Plugin. You can leverage this new plugin to easily connect your CAP application with SAP Integration Suite Advanced Event Mesh and start publishing or consuming events. Check out the plugin documentation to find out more about how to set up this plugin. I'm including the links in the description. Happy eventing!

[DJ] The conference season is very much in full swing, keeping us developer advocates busy. From organizing and running Devtoberfest through giving the Developer Keynote and running the Developer Garage at TechEd in Berlin and lots more and now many of the team are playing a major role in the On Tour part of the event with a stop in Sydney one in Melbourne and now as you've seen from an earlier item in this very news episode one in Singapore on their way to Bangalore. Over on this side of the world we have coming up the SAP UK and Ireland user group conference Connect. It's a great event it's happening from Sunday the 30th of November through Tuesday the 2nd of December that's right It's like a family reunion lots of discussions take place learning is shared and friendships are made. I'm very honored to be there, I'm running two sessions a hands-on workshop on modeling with CAP's CDS and also a tech talk on local first development with CAP. If you're attending Connect, come along and say hello in fact come to the sessions - the only thing you need to bring is your curiosity. See you there!

[Mamikee] The latest SAP BTP ABAP Environment release 25.11 is here, and it has been available since November 15th. And it's packed with upgrades across ADT, RAP, Fiori, business configuration, integration, and more. So here's a few highlights you don't want to miss. First, big feature drops across the tooling. In ADT, you now get Ghost Text Keyword Completion as the new default. A new editor for email templates. You can create custom email templates using the Maintain Email Template apps and full business configuration set editing right inside ADT. Plus, macOS users, the graphical call timeline for ABAP traces is now supported. In RAP, you can now log base change documents as business events using the new syntax to READ ENTITY, with changes to inspect change operation and define global side effects that refresh UI properties automatically with a single keystroke. Now, this was only a handful of updates. For the full list of updates, read the blog post in the description below.

[Anja & Michael] Welcome here in Berlin TechEd 2025 on site it's so great we handed over from the Devtoberfest now we're here and a lot of TechEd tour stops will join. I'm very happy to have you here, I know that you joined the Devtoberfest and not just joining you did win the Devtoberfest. It's so amazing so what was your experience what did you like, what was your highlight of that? Devtoberfest was incredible. The opportunity to experience the different areas of SAP and to become exposed to those areas was incredible. Having a focus on web technologies, but being exposed to the other services that I was not exposed to prior was very eye-opening and made me a really deep, deep dive into those areas. So I was able to draw some insights that I could reflect back into my work at my work camp. And that's great and now being here on site being on TechEd so what did you ... was thinking or wishing for and what is your highlight here? Oh I was wishing for more and I got more more than that um it was really incredible because it was non -stop sessions um hands-on road mapping um in so many different areas it was uh morning to evening of of of consuming information that I can take back and be empowered with. So I'm very excited to go back and share what I've learned this week. Thank you so much. Thank you.

entry.title: Re: ACR - MX LOCALIZATION - Missing Reporting Activities...
entry.content:
The Reporting Activities Dates delivered in the note are wrong

There are the following dates:

Valid From: When the report is must be used

Use As Of: When you want to start using the report

Use Until: When you want to stop using the report

Please fix manually, and then the reporting activities will be created

entry.title: SAP Ariba AI for Dummies
entry.content:
If you‚Äôre feeling like things are moving quicker than you can keep up, you‚Äôre not alone. This blog is meant to give you a clear, practical understanding of what AI means inside the SAP Ariba ecosystem today, what use cases matter, and how procurement teams can start adopting these capabilities with confidence.

If you would like to read more about AI in Procurement, check this blog.

What AI in SAP Ariba is

SAP IA is built on BTP and leverages the entire SAP ecosystem to serve as an AI orchestrator agent trained on SAP data, reducing hallucinations.

 

The AI and available use cases combine predictive models, generative AI, automation, and embedded insights across SAP Ariba to enable the transition from tactical to strategic procurement. How? By allowing customers to start experiencing AI now.

Ariba, with its diverse AI capabilities, can recommend suppliers to participate in a sourcing event, guide users in selecting the most compliant supplier when looking for a new laptop, and, with its most advanced capabilities, even create an event from a conversation with Joule, the AI assistant of SAP.

Some of the capabilities available now are:

  • Category strategy assistant, using generative AI to create category strategies and spend narratives.
  • AI-Enhanced Sourcing, which learns from the users‚Äô behaviour and can recommend suppliers and content, as well as provide scoring guidance.
  • Guided Buying with AI Recommendations, including recommended buying channels and preferred supplier identification for better compliance.
  • Spend Analysis and Insights, which understands and analyzes the data, provides enriched categorization and identifies savings opportunities.
  • Joule, to answer procurement questions, help users navigate tasks, and provide guidance on what to consider for the next step in the process.

Look to these OnePagers for more information. AI In Guided Buying. AI in Guided Sourcing. SAP Ariba CatMan. Joule for SAP Ariba

What‚Äôs needed?

Depending on the capability you want, you might need more or fewer requirements. If we talk about AI-Enhanced Sourcing or Guided Buying with AI Recommendations, these functionalities are embedded and can be enabled and used by your IT team right after reading this blog.

Now, when we talk about Joule, and you want to start with the very first steps to get it, you have 4 prerequisites + 4 steps to activate Joule for Base AI

Pre requisites

  1. Data quality, as it will impact AI effectiveness
  2. To have a Cloud Solution (Example: Ariba or Fieldglass)
  3. To have a BTP enterprise global account
  4. Activate the authentication service (IAS/IPS)

Steps 

  1. Order the zero-cost SKU 8019544.
  2. Accept Joule T&C
  3. Joule enablement through Booster
  4. Activate workzone (in BTP) and configure navigation services

To learn more about how to get started with Joule in Ariba, check this blog.

Conclusion and call to action

AI is not magic, and many users assume AI ‚Äújust works,‚Äù but like any powerful tool, it performs best when guided, validated, and supported with clean, reliable data.

When embraced thoughtfully, AI in SAP Ariba becomes more than a feature: it becomes a force multiplier.

Start with one process. Try one AI feature. Experiment with one workflow. Build confidence. Strengthen your data. Upskill your users. And lean into the capabilities Ariba already offers, whether it‚Äôs guided buying insights, automated invoice processing, generative content creation, or supplier recommendation. You don‚Äôt need to master everything at once; you just need to take the first step.

entry.title: AI in Procurement
entry.content:
Artificial Intelligence is no longer a conversation you‚Äôll have in the near future or something you can afford to be unprepared for. In SAP, we understand it and make it a priority, but‚Ä¶ What‚Äôs really in there for you?

Why AI in procurement matters now

Procurement is evolving as fast as AI, and teams are becoming a strategic piece for every company. With that comes new responsibilities and the constant push for compliance, sustainability, transparency, and, of course, savings. And how do we get there? Procurement has always had much data that needs to be processed manually, which has easily become a bottleneck for strategic sourcing, leading to reactive, tactical supply chains.

And here is where AI takes place. AI can perform approximately "10 million to 10 billion operations per second, while the conscious capacity of the human brain is estimated at only 10 to 50 bits per second". And here comes the sweet spot: AI automates repetitive tasks and reduces human error, improving accuracy and speed in the analysis and management of large volumes of data, while the human brain provides irreplaceable adaptation, subjective learning, and deep interpretation, plus the understanding of the business needs and preferences to make smarter decisions.

Procurement departments have the data; AI can process it in detail, and procurement users will interpret it and make better decisions. Doesn‚Äôt it sound great?

AI is emerging as the first technology capable of realistically reducing manual effort and increasing strategic impact. It‚Äôs expected to ‚Äútransform procurement by automating up to 60% of source-to-pay tasks‚Äù.

Embrace AI thoughtfully

Will AI replace the procurement process? A frequent question among professionals: Where is my job situated in the future? The reality is that we are facing a massive revolution in innovative technologies that automate manual steps. Teams that start preparing and adopting now will be far ahead in efficiency and strategic impact.

Procurement professionals will shift toward supplier strategy, innovation, sustainability, and resilience. But your company, your team, and yourself need to be prepared. AI is nothing without high-quality data. If the data is fragmented, inconsistent, or outdated, models will amplify those flaws.

If your process has a lot of manual steps like paperwork, emails, and unstandardized spreadsheets, you might need to start working on your quality data to be able to trust the model recommendations once it is in place.

If you would like to learn more about SAP Ariba AI, check this blog.

Conclusion and call to action

AI adoption comes with real barriers: it can feel like jumping into the unknown, and there is often a false belief that AI already understands the full procurement context and doesn‚Äôt require human validation. This is not true. AI accelerates work, but it still needs guardrails, good data, and informed oversight.

When implemented thoughtfully, AI becomes a powerful ally. It can process enormous volumes of data in seconds, uncover insights that teams could never find manually, and eliminate repetitive tasks that slow procurement down. The result is a procurement area that is not just efficient but strategic, contributing directly to value creation, risk reduction, innovation, and sustainability.

So the call to action is simple:

Start small, learn fast, and build the foundations today. Strengthen your data, upskill your team, and begin experimenting with AI-driven processes. The companies that take the first steps now will define the future of procurement. Those who wait will be forced to catch up later, on someone else‚Äôs terms.

entry.title: Impersonation not working in Crystal Reports SP38 ASP.NET
entry.content:
We recently upgraded our ASP.NET application using Crystal Reports for .NET from SP25 to SP38 and noticed a change in behavior:

  • Previously (SP25): impersonation via <identity impersonate="true" /> or WindowsIdentity.Impersonate worked; reports ran under the authenticated user's identity.

  • Now (SP38): Crystal Reports always uses the IIS Application Pool identity, ignoring impersonation.

This has been verified using WindowsIdentity.GetCurrent() and SELECT SYSTEM_USER in SQL Server.

  1. Is this change in behavior in SP38 intentional and supported?

  2. Is there a supported way for Crystal Reports to respect impersonation in SP38?

Additional information:

  • ASP.NET 4.8

  • IIS 10, Application Pool: ApplicationPoolIdentity

  • SQL Server 2022

  • Crystal Reports SP38 runtime for .NET

Thank you.

Omar M.

entry.title: Re: S/4 HANA Public Cloud: How to print Standard Text in...
entry.content:
Hi ramanjaneyareddy_p

Have you investigated the app Manage Texts (https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/ea1de51751ea4576af091b58d43b0b14.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US)

Then you define which texts go on the master template with Define Rules for Determination of Master Form Template

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/a630d57fc5004c6383e7a81efee7a8bb/d5807657a11a0522e10000000a44147b.html?version=LATEST&locale=en-US

I hope this helps

Thank you

Jerry

entry.title: Re: How to identify a Corporate IDP in the URL when using the DynamicIdentityProvider in SAP AppRout

entry.title: Tiempo de entrega en orden de compra con icoterm
entry.content:
Hola buen d√≠a 

Tengo un tema con las ordenes de compra que ustedes se que ya lo han tenido

Tengo una orden de compra el cual tiene un icoterm que dice que me entrega el prveedor en la puerta de su planta. Por lo que tengo que tomar en cuenta tambien el tiempo de trasporte desde su planta hasta mi planta de fabricaci√≥n para tener el material disponible en planta. 

Esoy utilizando el tiempo de "Planned delivery time" para saber cuando tengo que recogerlo en su planta pero eso implica que tengo que sumarle el tiempo de transporte de su planta a la mia y utilizo el campo de "GR processing" pero esto creo que no es correcto ya que es el tiempo que me tardar√≠a en procesar una entrada una vez que llega a mi planta

En este caso que soluciones hay para este caso? 

En espera de sus consejos 

Gracias

entry.title: PO delivery time with icoterm
entry.content:
Good morning.

I am writing to inform you of an issue with purchase orders that I believe you may have encountered.

I have a purchase order with an ICOTERM that states the supplier will deliver to the door of their plant. Therefore, it is also necessary for me to take into account the transport time from their plant to my manufacturing plant, in order to ensure that the material is available at the latter location.

I am using the "Planned delivery time" to determine when I have to pick it up at their plant, but this means I have to add the transport time from their plant to mine. I use the "GR processing" field, but I don't think this is correct, as it is the time it would take me to process an entry once it arrives at my plant.

In such cases, what solutions are available?

I would greatly appreciate your input on this matter.

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: SF Compensation worksheet - one time payment
entry.content:
Hi @Maria851 

It's not supported, it will only bring over the top of stack one time payment, it won't even respect your template's EC effective date.

 

You would need to sync up one time payments to MDFs to do this. Honestly I don't think it's worth it when it's already visible on the EC profile for managers. Unless you need it in calculations.

All the best,

Xavier

entry.title: Re: How do I connect a custom tables field with a system...
entry.content: @rhavin FMS means Formatted Search. Basically you can create and save a query in query manager, and then link that query to certain field so that it shows you required results. You can google it, there is plenty of documentation and examples.

entry.title: Beyond the Session: Operating SAP BTP Applications Efficiently
entry.content:
Thanks to everyone who joined my session at SAP TechEd Sydney on how to efficiently operate SAP BTP applications.
We explored what good operations look like on BTP. From monitoring and alerting, to automation, cost optimisation, and DevOps best practices.

If you‚Äôd like to dive deeper into some of the topics discussed, here are a few great follow-up reads:

SAP Cloud Logging Service https://help.sap.com/docs/cloud-logging/cloud-logging/what-is-sap-cloud-logging?locale=en-AU

Cloud ALM Overview https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm.html

Introducing SAP Cloud ALM https://learning.sap.com/courses/introducing-sap-cloud-alm

OpenTelemetry https://support.sap.com/en/alm/sap-cloud-alm/operations/expert-portal/data-collection-infrastructure.html?anchorId=section_873338493

Custom Apps Integration https://github.com/SAP-samples/alm-demo-session

SAP BTP Terraform Provider https://registry.terraform.io/providers/SAP/btp/latest/docs

Getting started with Terraform provider for BTP https://learning.sap.com/courses/getting-started-with-terraform-on-sap-btp

DORA Metrics https://dora.dev/guides/dora-metrics-four-keys/

Application AutoScaler https://help.sap.com/docs/application-autoscaler/application-autoscaler/what-is-application-autoscaler?locale=en-AU

It was great connecting with so many of you. See you at the next TechEd or in the BTP community discussions!

Manage cost rates-plan

Routing with their Activivity type and work center.

Thank you.

entry.title: Re: How to do background scheduling with clean core, including Fiori apps, replacing se38 reports
entry.content:
Dear mlauber
First of all nice post üëèüëè!

Do you know if is possible to subscribe a trigger at the finish of a JOB as clean core compliance?
I have the following scenario:

I am exposing an async API that runs a standard job using a standard template with the method CL_APJ_RT_API=SCHEDULE_JOB.

I need to start the triggering of the job and end the API calling immediately.
Then when the Job ends, trigger another process.

Thanks a lot!

entry.title: Need a license key for an internal training IDES system
entry.content:
Need a license key for a system that someone else owned that has left the company.

It expires tomorrow

System CREDIT_CARD_NUMBER50 

Hardware key WPHONE_NUMBER 

it's an SAP ERP 6.0 EHP8 & BW  (Netweaver 7.5)

I cannot seem to find a way to request a key since I don't have this system - I tried to create a new system and then I get the error with the license keys generated that it is the wrong system number and I cannot import the generated key

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Need a license key for an internal training IDES system
entry.content:
Dear customer,

In order to get an IDES license key, could you pls kindly refer to the following KBA for more detailed information and steps:

KBA 3451876 - How to request license key for IDES system 

"To request license key for IDES system, just follow the detailed steps as per KBA 2346021 and request the license key under customer's own technical installation number. "

Hope it helps. 

And should you have any further issue during the license key request, feel free to contact the license key support team by creating a case using component XX-SER-LIKEY. 

Thanks and regards,
SAP Support

The launcher for this new version does not seem to have started successfully. Could you please advise on how to resolve this? Alternatively, would you be able to guide me through the steps to identify the root cause? This issue has been troubling me for a long time. Thank you. Thanks a lot!

entry.title: Use of MDF Object in Variable Pay Employee History Rule
entry.content:
Hi Team,

In the Variable Pay template, the Employee History Rule is configured to bring in employees with ACTIVE status only, along with few other conditions like Bonus Plan = Annual Performance. We also have an MDF object created where we are storing an employee's information for excluding the employee's Unpaid Leave period (As there is no LOA/Time-off in EC). The rule is working fine and excluding the periods of Unpaid Leave as expected.

However, we also need to exclude the period when employee goes on Suspension (status = Suspended) in EC. System is behaving correctly and excluding the period of Suspension for few employees, specifically for those who have no record in MDF. But for those employees who do have a record in MDF, system is not able to identify the period of suspension and is still bringing it in EH section. 

Example Scenario:

Employee: ABC
Suspension Start Date in EC (Status = Suspended): 1 Feb 2024
Suspension End Date in EC (Status = Active): 29 Feb 2024
Unpaid Leave Start Date in MDF: 1 June 2024
Unpaid Leave End Date in MDF: 31 July 2024

Expected outcome was:

1st Jan - 31st Jan, 29th Feb - 31st May, 31st July to 31st Dec. However, system is not able to exclude the period of 1st Feb to 29th Feb from EH rule.

Could you please help as to what may be the issue here? Appreciate your guidance as always @xavierlegarrec

entry.title: Re: Workflow Configuration for SAP S/4HANA Sales Price
entry.content:
Hello all,

We don't support workflow condition based on product division and also don't support an attachment in the workflow email util now. If you have such requirement, you could create request from Customer Influence . Sorry for the late reply.

entry.title: Re: Copy Comp Review
entry.content: Probably the error isn't with the translatable field message but with the Pay Matrix or something else. Can you share the screenshot of the error message and your Pay Matrix configuration ? Could it that one of the attributes that was used in the Pay Matrix before got deleted in T1 as part of dev work ?

entry.title: SAP SD Rebates migration to SAP S4 HANA Settlement Management historic data
entry.content:
Hi Gurus,

We are in middle of system conversion from SAP ECC to SAP S4 HANA. Client has a requirement o migrate entire billing from past 10 years along with settled rebates document and rebate agreements for audit purposes.

Is it feasible to migrate closed agreements and settlement documents from ECC to S4 if we have the billing documents also migrated into S4.

Generally its not good practive to migrate closed agreements and archive and use reporting on archived data for future purpose is best practive but client wants to migrate the data.

Any help on how to approach this migration will be helpful and willit need a custom conversion program or which tool will be apt for this conversion. Any direction on this is much appreciated.

Thanks,

Santosh

@Lakshmipathi @NagarajP @Chris1973

entry.title: SAP Enable Now: SAP Companion Global Link Tiles
entry.content:
My goal is to create a single "context-free" Link Tile (e.g., "Log a Support Case") that persists in the main Help Topics list across all pages in SuccessFactors, rather than being tied to a specific screen.
 
I have attempted to create this via the in-app editor, but it automatically locks the tile to the current page's context (e.g., HOME_V4). I suspect the solution involves editing the tile properties in the Manager to remove the context, but I want to ensure I am following the correct procedure.

entry.title: SAP B1 Boyum P&D Config
entry.content:
Hi team, 

Hope you are well. I wanted to reach out to understand configuration for Boyum B1 UP / B1 Print & Delivery. 
So our implementation partner assigned and set up Boyum for our group database. Now this group database is comprised of SAP B1 10.0 + Computec Add On (Process Force + WMS+PDC) And ofcourse Boyum B1 UP and P&D. 
We want to have similar set up except computec add on in another database in the same instance. However, when trying to configure the boyum add on in that, there is discrepancy within the menu items of what i can see in the Group DB vs the new db. 
Unsure how i can utilize the reports that are in the group db to the other db? 
Or how can i set up boyum to utilize them please?

entry.title: Re: Bank Reconciliation Accounts in S/4HANA 2020
entry.content:
@Pablo_Romo : How you handle default profit center assignment with FAGL3KEH?

I think as we create just one GL Account for multiple house bank, profit center can be assigned to the GL account. Unless, you want to differ a profit center per bank account, you have to create substitution for that.
